pullRequest.body:
Taking cexp of an infinite sum of logs gives a tprod.


---

### PR summary [e8f40829cd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15378/commits/e8f40829cd12818904fbf69b43273cf04b5b1f01)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Complex.HasSum_cexp_HasProd`
`+ Complex.cexp_tsum_eq_tprod`
`+ Complex.summable_cexp_multipliable`
`+ Real.HasSum_rexp_HasProd`
`+ Real.rexp_tsum_eq_tprod`
`+ Real.summable_cexp_multipliable`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> It feels like we would want much more API around this. For instance:
> 
>     1. a version for `ℝ`
> 
>     2. `Summable`-ity conditions
> 
>     3. `HasSum`/`HasProd` versions
> 
> 
> Do you want to add these, or explain why we shouldn't?

Good point, I've added the real version and the HasSum/HasProd versions. What do you mean about the summable conditions? I'm breaking up a big PR which will have things like 
```
lemma summable_multipliable (f : ℕ → ℂ) (hf : Summable f) (hff : ∀ n : ℕ, 1 + f n  ≠ 0) :
    Multipliable (fun n : ℕ => (1 + f n)) := by
```
Is this what you mean? sorry I'm probably just confused.

EDIT:  Ok I think I maybe know what you mean, I've added a summable/multipliable lemma in each case, hopefully this is what you meant.

Nice! Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10539412613/job/29202967068)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10539412613/job/29202967123)

It feels like we would want much more API around this. For instance:

1. a version for `ℝ`
2. `Summable`-ity conditions
3. `HasSum`/`HasProd` versions

Do you want to add these, or explain why we shouldn't?
Yes, this was essentially the idea I had in mind. Primarily just clean-up below, although it could be nice if two of the statements changed (see below).

```suggestion
    (hf : ∀ x : α, Summable fun n => log (f n x)) (a : α):
```

```suggestion
    (hf : ∀ x : α, HasSum (fun n => log (f n x)) (∑' i, log (f i x))) (a : α) :
```

```suggestion
    (hf : ∀ x : α, Summable fun n => log (f n x)) (a : α):
```

```suggestion
    (hf : ∀ x : α, Summable fun n => log (f n x)) :
      (cexp ∘ (fun a : α => (∑' n : ι, log (f n a)))) =
        (fun a : α => ∏' n : ι, (f n a)) := by
```

I can see why you wrote the `HasProd` as `rexp ∘ ...` but I think it makes more sense here to go straight to `Π`, no? I know the proof of some of these results may get *slightly* more complicated as a result, but I think it's worth it for a better statement. Same for the `Complex` version below.
```suggestion
    (hf : ∀ x : α, HasSum (fun n => log (f n x)) (∑' i, log (f i x))) (a : α) :
       HasProd (fun b ↦ f b a) ((rexp ∘ fun a ↦ ∑' (n : ι), log (f n a)) a) := by
```
Do you mean just prove: `HasProd (fun b ↦ f b a) ∏' n : ι, ((f n a))`?
Yep
Ok cool, I don't know if I did it the most efficent way, but its not that much worse than what we had before.

```suggestion
lemma Real.rexp_tsum_eq_tprod (f : ι → α → ℝ) (hfn : ∀ x n, 0 < f n x)
    (hf : ∀ x : α, Summable fun n => log (f n x)) :
      (rexp ∘ (fun a : α => (∑' n : ι, log (f n a)))) =
        (fun a : α => ∏' n : ι, (f n a)) := by
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Complex/Log): Exponential tsum is tprod
